003
004package kut;
005
006import java.util.function.Function;
007import java.util.ArrayList;
008
009/** Package of a value that can be null. */
010public class Opt<T> {
011  final T value;
012
013  Opt (T value) {
014    this.value = value;
015  }
016
017  /**
018   * Creates an Opt of type 'some'.
019   * @param <T> Value type.
020   * @param value The value. It it is null, this functions is equals to 'none'.
021   * @return Opt
022   */
023  public static <T> Opt<T> some (T value) {
024    return new Opt<>(value);
025  }
026
027  /**
028   * Creates an Opt of type 'none'.
029   * @param <T> Value type.
030   * @return Opt
031   */
032  public static <T> Opt<T> none () {
033    return new Opt<>(null);
034  }
035
036  /**
037   * Returns 'true' if 'this' is of type 'none'
038   * @return 'true' if 'this' is of type 'none'
039   */
040  public boolean isNone () {
041    return value == null;
042  }
043
044  /**
045   * Returns the result value.
046   * @return The result value.
047   * @throws IllegalStateException y 'this' is of type 'none'.
048   */
049  public T getValue () {
050    if (value == null)
051      throw new IllegalStateException("Opt is 'none'");
052    return value;
053  }
054
055  /**
056   * Returns the result of apply 'f' to the value of 'this'.
057   * If this is of type 'none', returns also an Opt of type 'none'.
058   * @param <U> Opt returned type.
059   * @param f Function to apply.
060   * @return Opt.
061   */  public <U> Opt<U> bind (Function<T, Opt<U>> f) {
062    return value == null
063      ? none()
064      : f.apply(value)
065    ;
066  }
067
068  @Override
069  public String toString () {
070    return value == null
071      ? "Opt[None]"
072      : "Opt[Some: " + value.toString() + "]"
073    ;
074  }
075
076  /**
077   * Returns Opt 'JSONized' in 'js'.
078   * @param <T> Type of Opt element.
079   * @param js Opt 'JSONized'.
080   * @param eFromJs Function to restore the element of the Opt 'JSONized' in 'js'.
081   * @return The Opt 'JSONized" in 'js'.
082   */
083  public static <T> Opt<T> fromJs (String js, Function<String, T> eFromJs) {
084    ArrayList<String> a = Js.ra(js);
085    if (a.size() > 1) {
086      js = js.length() <= 50 ? js : js.substring(47) + "...";
087      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
088      "  \n'" + js + "' is not a valid Opt JSONization." +
089      "  \n Opt JSONization type are: \"[]\" or \"[JS-element]\""
090      );
091    }
092    return a.size() == 0
093      ? Opt.none()
094      : Opt.some(eFromJs.apply(a.get(0)))
095    ;
096  }
097
098  /**
099   * Returns JSON representation of 'o':<p>
100   * "[]" for Opt.none() and <br>
101   * "[JS-element]" for Opt.some(element).
102   * @param <T> Type of 'o' element.
103   * @param o Opt.
104   * @param eToJs Function to 'JSONize' the element of 'o'.
105   * @return JSON representation of 'o'.
106   */
107  public static <T> String toJs (Opt<T> o, Function<T, String> eToJs) {
108    return o.isNone() ? Js.w(Arr.mk()) : Js.w(Arr.mk(eToJs.apply(o.value)));
109  }
110}
